Function Documentation

bool checkModes ( const cmd_word  m  ) 

Tests a word for adressing modes legality. The whole instruction word is tested, in order to determine whether the adressing modes used in it are legal for the instruction it contains.

Returns:
true if the adressing modes are legal.

Instr getInstruction ( const cmd_word  m  ) 

Returns the instruction encoded in the given word. This accessor is an interface to the private "instructions" array.

See also:
instructions.h::Instr

bool instr_jmp ( SIVM *  sivm,
REG *  dest,
const cmd_word  source 
)

Emulates the JMP command in the given SIVM. This instruction takes only one parameter above the targeted SIVM, source, but keeps the dest argument for type compatibility. WARNING the argument to use is source and not dest. Argument validity will be checked.

Parameters:
source the adress at which the PC register of the given SIVM should be put at.
Returns:
true if the command was successful, false if the PC argument is out of memory bounds.

Variable Documentation

Instr instructions[]

Initial value:

 {
        [LOAD] = {instr_load,   FM_REGDIR | FM_REGIMM | FM_REGIND,                              "LOAD"},
        [STORE] = {instr_store, FM_DIRIMM | FM_DIRREG | FM_INDIMM | FM_INDREG,  "STORE"},
        [ADD] = {instr_add,             FM_REGREG | FM_REGIMM | FM_REGDIR | FM_REGIND,  "ADD"},
        [SUB] = {instr_sub,             FM_REGREG | FM_REGIMM | FM_REGDIR | FM_REGIND,  "SUB"},
        [JMP] = {instr_jmp,             FM_REGREG | FM_REGIMM | FM_REGDIR | FM_REGIND,  "JMP"},
        [JEQ] = {instr_jeq,             FM_REGREG | FM_REGIMM | FM_REGDIR | FM_REGIND,  "JEQ"},
        [MOV] = {instr_mov,             FM_REGREG | FM_REGIMM,                                                  "MOV"}
}
Describes all available instructions. This array has keys taken from the "instructions" enum, and its values describe the corresponding instructions, as an array containing :
  1. a pointer to the function emulating the instruction to execute
  2. a bitfield describing which adressing modes are legal for this instruction
The bitfield element is created from bit-to-bit OR operations between all the f_modes enum elements.
See also:
instructions.h::enum instructions

instructions.h::enum f_modes

getInstruction
